meanings.definition: An action or event preceding or preparing for something more important or serious.
meanings.sent1: The team meeting was just a preliminary to the big presentation next week.
meanings.sent2: The preliminary round of the competition helped determine the finalists.
meanings.sent3: The preliminary taste test of the new recipe left everyone eager for more.
meanings.sent4: His early morning jog was a preliminary to his daily workout routine.
meanings.sent5: The preliminary investigation revealed crucial evidence for the case.

meanings.definition: Serving as a preliminary step or stage in a process.
meanings.sent1: The preliminary report provided initial insights into the project's feasibility.
meanings.sent2: She completed the preliminary research before diving deeper into the topic.
meanings.sent3: The preliminary sketches of the building design were surprisingly detailed.
meanings.sent4: The preliminary results hinted at a successful outcome for the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The preliminary analysis highlighted key areas for improvement in the plan.
